definition: an authoritative command, a formal order from a superior court or official to an inferior one
an authorization to act given to a representative
examples: accepted the mandate of the people

definition: an order or commission granted by the League of Nations to a member nation for the establishment of a responsible government over a former German colony or other conquered territory
to administer or assign (something, such as a territory) under a mandate
to officially require (something) : make (something) mandatory : order, to direct or require (someone) to do something
examples: a commission mandated to investigate corruption
